alert.note: Alert for Northern Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 12:23AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Brunswick, southwestern Columbus and northeastern Horry Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1223 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dulah, or 12 miles north of Little River, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shallotte, Sunset Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Iredell, Carolina Shores, Tabor City, Calabash, Bethel, Civie Town, Freeland, Grissettown, Nakina, Mollie, Bughill, Sidney, Longwood, Williams, Russtown, Pireway and Dulah. This includes US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
